column1: #Text=French citizens told to leave Ivory Coast as UN warns of civil war
#Text=Map highlighting location of the Ivory Coast .
#Text=The French government has urged its citizens to leave the Ivory Coast ( Côte d'Ivoire ) as the United Nations ( U.N. ) warned that the country was heading towards a civil war .
#Text=According to the U.N. , there has been an increase in the use of intimidation methods by elements of the national security forces loyal to incumbent president Laurent Gbagbo .

#Text= We ask those who can , to leave Ivory Coast temporarily until the situation normalises , " said Francois Baroin , a government spokesperson .

column1: #Text=On Saturday , Gbagbo ordered the U.N. and French peacekeepers to leave the country saying , " The government demands the departure of the UNOCI and LICORNE [ French ] forces in Ivory Coast and is opposed to any renewal of their mandate .

#Text=Gbagbo offered for several entities to investigate the election results , which was rejected by Ouattara who said  we 've finished with these games .

_	_	_	_

#Text= I am ... ready to welcome a committee ... headed by the African Union , involving ECOWAS , the Arab League , the United Nations , United States , the European Union , Russia and China , which will have permission to analyse objectively the facts of the electoral process ... to solve this crisis peacefully , " Gbagbo said in a statement .

column1: #Text=The U.N. said it has no plans to leave the country saying , " the president-elect is Ouattara and he has n't asked us to leave " and that they intend to " fulfill its mandate and will continue to monitor and document any human rights violations , incitement to hatred and violence , or attacks on U.N. peacekeepers .
